pullRequest.title: Support writing IIDM-XML network extensions in previous versions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com
Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements (please use '[x]' to check the checkboxes, or submit the PR and then click the checkboxes)

 The commit message follows our guidelines
 Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)

What kind of change does this PR introduce? (Bug fix, feature, docs update, ...)
Feature
What is the current behavior? (You can also link to an open issue here)
Network extensions can only be serialized in their latest version.
What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?
A user can choose the version in which they want to serialize their network extensions.
Does this PR introduce a breaking change or deprecate an API? If yes, check the following:
No

commit.message:
Support writing IIDM-XML network extensions in previous versions

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

Add control on ExportOptions.addExtensionVersion

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

always take options extension version into account

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

afterCommit.message:
always take options extension version into account

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

small correction in tests

nodes.bodyText: I don't understand how these two methods will be used. Could you explain it to me?

commit.message:
add NetworkXmlWriterContext.getExtensionVersion() and check the version exists before writing

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

add test for unsupported extension version

support config extensions version on config file + add test

nodes.bodyText: Why do you create this variable here, and why use memoize?
Uncompatible should be Incompatible. Why didn't you use the same name basis as the two other tests below?
